intro: Tarenna glomeriflora, commonly known as the clustered-flowered tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact shrub form and clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, with a distinctive aromatic scent. Tarenna glomeriflora is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
